name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"9d3d2ac2-6657-4030-ab7a-89bc66ba7e34","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: visit_ClassDef","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"40e32393-9277-448b-9870-40e4002f2113","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_ClassDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is the architect for analyzing Python classes. When the analyzer encounters a class definition (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"class MyModel(BaseModel):","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), this function takes over. Its job is not just to register the class name, but to construct the entire inheritance hierarchy, establish the scope for methods and attributes, and prepare the environment for analyzing the code inside the class.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d45daf4a-a08b-4ab6-b4d1-2a14767730c4","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Object-oriented programming relies heavily on context. If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Child","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inherits from ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Parent","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", calling ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"child.method()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" might actually be running code inside ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Parent","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_ClassDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ensures the analyzer understands this relationship. It resolves "bases" (parent classes), computes the Method Resolution Order (MRO), and sets up the specialized ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" variable so that instance attribute access works correctly.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"562469cf-14a0-4e95-8f85-7da7b08df114","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c74b5f59-fddc-459b-a0cf-69b66b7dd292","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace & Scope Setup:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"e29d9511-ea49-441c-9a4c-e7e45a4d155c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It determines the full namespace (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.MyClass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b36e0c8f-fee7-4f5a-bb01-d100c9a25663","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It creates a new ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the class. This is where methods like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will live.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"25252a09-a87f-4e66-bea1-f00408f251a9","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Special Variable Creation:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"e0fd6633-1850-4b96-b9df-69948ee58630","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"<return>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It creates a return definition that points to the class itself. This tells the analyzer that calling ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"MyClass()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" returns an instance of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"MyClass","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"286f74a3-7050-4847-be66-5b8ef345574c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It explicitly defines ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" within the class scope. This is critical for linking ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.variable","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" usages back to the class definition later.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"e9e08602-35eb-4b7f-9c1a-3dbb0cb4047c","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inheritance Resolution (The Logic Core):","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"5fe167ad-1dac-4b88-88c4-7144eae76657","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It iterates through the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"node.bases","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (the parent classes listed in the definition).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b9887f37-8f24-41f5-bfdd-0aa72ddde117","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It "visits" these nodes to ensure they are analyzed (e.g., if the base is imported).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8808f11b-6e3c-48d1-b94b-a410a7b84212","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It resolves the names of these bases to their actual Definition objects (e.g., resolving ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"BaseModel","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"library.models.BaseModel","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c5fe2daf-f8e3-4201-883d-34845dc140d4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It registers these parents with the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"class_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"f5be5055-a280-4261-aed5-175c725578fa","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"MRO Calculation:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"489a513a-0d2e-4a4e-8f42-b537160be4ac","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It triggers ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"cls.compute_mro()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This calculates the Method Resolution Order—the specific sequence Python follows to find methods in a hierarchy. This allows the analyzer to know exactly which ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"run()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method is executed if multiple parents define it.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"887638fa-3d92-40f9-9271-57c13457e72d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Context Switching:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"fbc81026-cb97-43b2-b711-43567502aff8","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Finally, it calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pushStack(cls_def)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This switches the analyzer's "current context" to be inside the class, so subsequent method definitions are correctly placed inside this class scope rather than the global scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"52e0eab5-c288-457e-abfc-2f74fcfc7a0f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Code being analyzed:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c0256f6d-5d24-4f52-a81b-14e2f5a09194","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from framework import Entity

class Player(Entity):
    def jump(self):

","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_ClassDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" hits ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"class Player(Entity)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9e19efcd-1213-477a-86bf-897e68b4099f","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It creates the scope ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.Player","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6482a5c1-6009-4ad6-afda-12473da11efd","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Self:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It defines ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.Player.self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and says "this points to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.Player","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cc729910-54b1-4993-a3ec-7630c208c31a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inheritance:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"31a13229-0db8-4bdd-b6b8-6dab2a772e11","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It looks at ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Entity","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a23d14bc-65d3-4586-8c4b-2d2ba71dd4c6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It traces ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Entity","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" back to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"framework.Entity","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2aabdb7a-2fa5-4c7e-ac7d-6d2f64fa4389","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It records ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Player","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a child of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"framework.Entity","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"3b1c6db5-27b4-4b9d-a15d-1764907e4318","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"MRO:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It asks the Class Manager to compute the MRO. The manager looks at ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Entity","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s parents and builds the full lookup list.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1f8ec305-e168-4c4d-a419-83cbd6101dda","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Traversal:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It pushes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.Player","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" onto the stack. The analyzer then moves inside to process ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"def jump(self):","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Because the stack is set, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"jump","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is correctly identified as a method of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Player","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"57cceda1-30ff-4639-9682-2816059068dc","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
